full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 227 of 236 1131
LC3Cmax7 Dawson - cross
1 A. Yes.
2 Q. And he didn't voluntarily come on his own; is that right?
3 A. Yes.
4 Q. And he came to the station and he agreed to be interviewed; isn't that right?
5 A. Yes.
6 Q. And he came to the police station a little bit later that day, I believe; is that right?
7 A. Yes.
8 Q. And you put him in an interview room?
9 A. Yes.
10 Q. And you read him his Miranda rights?
11 A. Yes.
12 Q. And he acknowledged that he understood those rights, didn't he?
13 A. Yes.
14 Q. Including his right to remain silent?
15 A. Yes.
16 Q. But he voluntarily agreed to waive those rights and talk to you; isn't that right?
17 A. Yes.
18 Q. Now, isn't it true that in his statement to you on that day, October 15th, 2003, Juan Alessi told you that approximately six weeks before at about 5:00 a.m. or 0500 hours on a Sunday morning, he decided to enter Mr. Epstein's house at
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00012741
